slide.title: Generative Models
points: A generative model outputs new examples from a distribution of provided examples.
GANs are an implementation of a generative model.

slide.title: Components of GANs
points: GANs consist of two parts: the Generator and the Discriminator.
The Generator generates new examples within the distribution of training data.
The Discriminator determines the probability that an example is from the training data.

slide.title: Training the GANs
points: The Generator and Discriminator are trained using backpropagation.
The Generator and Discriminator train each other as adversaries.
The goal is to train a strong generative model.

slide.title: Key Papers on GANs
points: Generative Adversarial Nets: Introduction to GAN architecture.
Unsupervised Representation Learning with Deep Convolutional Generative Adversarial Networks (DCGANs): Guidance on using CNNs in GANs.
Improved Techniques for Training GANs: Concepts for training robust GAN models.
A Style-Based Generator Architecture for Generative Adversarial Networks: Techniques for generating examples influenced by specific styles.
slide.imageDescription: Collage of key papers on GANs

slide.title: Applications of GANs
points: Unpaired Image-to-Image Translation: Generating labels from unlabeled input images.
GANcraft: Generating 3D photo-realistic worlds from Minecraft worlds.
